html_content:
Continue reading the main story

Highlights

  1. A Teenager Went 3 Floors Down to Play Video Games. He Never Came Home.

    Kahlik Grier, 16, was fatally shot in a random encounter in the stairwell of his Bronx apartment building, the police said.

    6h agoBy Edgar Sandoval

  2. A Casino in Manhattan? Strapped Developers Hope So

    With commercial real estate slumping, casino interests are lobbying the state to grant early approval for city-based casinos.

    8h agoBy Dana Rubinstein and Jesse McKinley

    1. Schools in the Pandemic: A Report Card

      ‘The Word of the Year Is Fluid’: The Pandemic Brings a New Teaching Style

      Like many districts nationwide, schools in Edison, N.J., are struggling to make hybrid instruction work.

      6h agoBy Tracey Tully

    2. 3 Die in National Guard Helicopter Crash Near Rochester

      The helicopter, which was on a routine training mission, crashed in a field. The cause of the accident is under investigation.

      13h agoBy Mihir Zaveri

  1. Saving a Place Where ‘It’s Halloween All Year’

    A costume store in the East Village might live for another Halloween season after a flood of customers came when the store announced plans to close.

    2h agoBy Daniel E. Slotnik

  2. Shipping delays postpone thousands of vaccinations in N.Y.C. while Cuomo says the state could temporarily run out of doses.

    2h agoBy Mihir Zaveri, Juliana Kim and Katie Thomas

  3. New York Today

    New Yorkers at the Inauguration Festivities

    Roles in the ceremony and related events included performing the national anthem and leading the vice president in the oath of office.

    5h agoBy Troy Closson

  4. ‘The Shining’ Scene, Stuff of Nightmares, Turns a Criminal Case Upside Down

    A prosecutor erred by likening a man charged with robbing a bank to Jack Nicholson’s violent psychopath, New Jersey’s highest court ruled.

    1d agoBy Ed Shanahan

  5. Queens Man Wanted ‘Execution’ of Schumer and Ocasio-Cortez, U.S. Says

    Brendan Hunt, a fervent supporter of President Trump, is also accused of urging the killing of members of Congress before Inauguration Day.

    1d agoBy Amanda Rosa

Advertisement

Continue reading the main story

  • Latest
  • Search

  1. On the Market

    Homes for Sale in Brooklyn, Manhattan and Staten Island

    This week’s properties are in Park Slope, the East Village and Park Slope.

    By Sydney Franklin

    Jan. 21, 2021

  2. On the Market

    Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey

    This week’s properties are six-bedroom houses in Babylon, N.Y., and Edison, N.J.

    By Jill P. Capuzzo and Claudia Gryvatz Copquin

    Jan. 21, 2021

  3. Moynihan Train Hall Becomes a Destination: ‘This Gives Us Hope’

    Pandemic-weary visitors are finding uplift in the new station, with its soaring expanses of glass and light. “Perfect quarantine activity,” one says.

    By Cara Buckley and Sean Piccoli

    Jan. 21, 2021

  4. ‘Moulin Rouge!’ Was Their Ticket. Then 2020 Happened.

    It was a Broadway smash with big plans until 25 company members took ill and a shutdown put everybody out of work. Inside a tumultuous year, in the words of those who lived it.

    By Michael Paulson

    Jan. 21, 2021

  5. ‘I Know I’m Not Alone’: The Importance of Mentors Right Now

    Most mentoring programs have moved online, but some wait lists are long and the rare person-to-person connection is sorely missed.

    By Alix Strauss

    Jan. 21, 2021

  6. weekend roundup

    5 Things to Do This Weekend

    Our critics and writers have selected noteworthy cultural events to experience virtually.

    Jan. 21, 2021

  7. Critic’s Pick

    Review: ‘Painting With John’ Teaches the Art of Living

    John Lurie’s eccentric HBO series is no Bob Ross how-to. Its lessons are stranger and deeper.

    By James Poniewozik

    Jan. 20, 2021

  8. Trump Pardons Hillel Nahmad, Madison Avenue Art Dealer

    The New York dealer, scion of a powerful art world family, pleaded guilty to running an illegal gambling ring in 2013.

    By Sarah Bahr

    Jan. 20, 2021

  9. John Lurie Doesn’t Paint Happy Trees

    His new series for HBO, “Painting With John,” is a meditative and often joyful blend of painting and personal storytelling. But Bob Ross it isn’t.

    By Robert Ito

    Jan. 20, 2021

  10. New York Today

    N.Y.C. Is Days Away From Running Out of Vaccine

    “We will have literally nothing left to give as of Friday,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said. The next shipment is expected on Tuesday. 

    By Troy Closson

    Jan. 20, 2021

Advertisement

Continue reading the main story
